pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:4.1: The sub-chapter on evenly all around
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were walking in inhabited areas with their bodies uncovered. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:7.2: “‘I will walk well-covered in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:8.1: Walking in an inhabited area, one should be well-covered.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:8.2: If a monk, out of disrespect, walks in an inhabited area with his body uncovered, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:9.8: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk3:10.1: The third training rule is finished.
